# llms.txt - AI/LLM Crawler Information for oops
# https://animeshkundu.github.io/oops/

name: oops
tagline: Blazingly fast command-line typo corrector
description: >
  oops is a command-line typo corrector written in Rust that fixes your previous 
  console command when you make a mistake. It provides 177+ correction rules, 
  sub-50ms startup time (10x faster than Python alternatives), and supports 
  Linux, macOS, and Windows.

repository: https://github.com/animeshkundu/oops
documentation: https://animeshkundu.github.io/oops/docs/
license: MIT
language: Rust

key_features:
  - Blazingly fast startup time (~30ms vs ~300ms for Python alternatives)
  - Single binary with no runtime dependencies
  - 177+ built-in correction rules
  - Cross-platform support (Linux, macOS, Windows)
  - Shell integration for Bash, Zsh, Fish, PowerShell, and Tcsh
  - Full compatibility with thefuck environment variables

installation:
  linux_macos: curl -fsSL https://animeshkundu.github.io/oops/install.sh | bash
  windows: irm https://animeshkundu.github.io/oops/install.ps1 | iex
  cargo: cargo install --git https://github.com/animeshkundu/oops
  homebrew: brew install animeshkundu/tap/oops

shell_integration: eval "$(oops --alias)"

comparison:
  - oops (Rust): ~30ms startup, ~5MB binary, ~10MB memory
  - thefuck (Python): ~300ms startup, requires Python, ~50MB memory

categories:
  - CLI tools
  - Developer tools
  - Command line
  - Terminal utilities
  - Shell enhancements
  - Rust applications

related_projects:
  - thefuck (Python original that inspired oops)
  - command-not-found
  - zsh-autosuggestions

contact: https://github.com/animeshkundu/oops/issues
